column1: Acolyte: You have spent your life in the service of a temple to a specific god or pantheon of gods. You act as an intermediary between the realm of the holy and the mortal world
column2: performing sacred rites and offering sacrifices in order to conduct worshipers into the presence of the divine. You are not necessarily a cleric performing sacred rites is not the same thing as channeling divine power.

column1: Sage: You spent years learning the lore of the multiverse. You scoured manuscripts
column3: and listened to the greatest experts on the subjects that interest you. Your efforts have made you a master in your fields of study.

column1: Spy: Although your capabilities are not much different from those of a burglar or smuggler
column2: you learned and practiced them in a very different context: as an espionage agent. You might have been an officially sanctioned agent of the crown
column3: or perhaps you sold the secrets you uncovered to the highest bidder.

column1: Hermit: You lived in seclusion either in a sheltered community such as a monastery
column2: or entirely alone for a formative part of your life. In your time apart from the clamor of society
column5: and perhaps some of the answers you were looking for.

column1: Urban Bounty Hunter: Before you became an adventurer
column2: your life was already full of conflict and excitement
column3: because you made a living tracking down people for pay. Unlike some people who collect bounties
column5: you aren't a savage who follows quarry into or through the wilderness. You're involved in a lucrative trade
column6: in the place where you live
column7: that routinely tests your skills and survival instincts. What's more
column9: as a bounty hunter in the wild would be: you routinely interact with both the criminal subculture and other bounty hunters
column10: maintaining contacts in both areas to help you succeed.
